data.title: Pagination construction
data.statement:
The task given to you is to identify which pages (by number) to display in the center of the pagination component.
You will be given the [[total]] number of pages in the website (numbered from 1 to [[total]]), the [[width]] of the pagination (number of pages displayed at a time), and the page number you should try to put in the [[center]] of the pagination.
However, the pagination [[width]] is prioritized over the [[center]] position.  If [[center]] is too close to the first or the last page and cannot be placed in the center, you must display [[width]] numbers from the first page or to the last page. 

<<Example>>
[[total]] = 7
[[width]] = 5
[[center]] = 2
The 5 numbers centered on 2 are {{0 1 2 3 4}}
Because this goes below 1, instead start at 1.
Output: <<1 2 3 4 5>>
data.stubGenerator:

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[total]] is total number of pages
<<Line 2:>> [[width]] is the pagination width
<<Line 3:>> [[center]] is the number you should put in the center of the pagination if possible
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>>  separated space array of [[width]] page numbers

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The task given to you is to identify which pages (by number) to display in the center of the pagination component.
You will be given the total number of pages in the website (numbered from 1 to total), the width of the pagination (number of pages displayed at a time), and the page number you should try to put in the center of the pagination.
However, the pagination width is prioritized over the center position. If center is too close to the first or the last page and cannot be placed in the center, you must display width numbers from the first page or to the last page.

Example
total = 7
width = 5
center = 2
The 5 numbers centered on 2 are 0 1 2 3 4
Because this goes below 1, instead start at 1.
Output: 1 2 3 4 5
Input
Line 1: total is total number of pages
Line 2: width is the pagination width
Line 3: center is the number you should put in the center of the pagination if possible
Output
Line 1: separated space array of width page numbers
Constraints
1 ≤ center ≤ total ≤ 100
1 ≤ width ≤ total
width is always odd.
Example
Input
10
5
4
Output
2 3 4 5 6
